item.title: premier article
item.description: how to debug c programs Once a C file is compiled it can be debugged. To do so will requires to improve compilatation by using gcc -g3 file.c then we start our program with adding a gdb prefix. gdb ./a.out tui e b main run [parameters] target record-full s rs q

item.title: premier article
item.description: build c programs A C program is a main function in a file dot c that must be compiled. We will use Gcc by simply executing the command gcc file.c Then we have a new file called binary, that is written for the computer exclusively.
